page.title: 14ROAD TRAFFIC
page.content: COUNCIL MEETING MAY 1985 In reply to a letter from the council expressing concren about the speed of locally,the chief constable wrote that although the miners, strike was now over, the force was still streched, but that everything possible would be done to improve the situation. whilst discssing this matter, the news correspondet requested that note be made that the council,s concern report in notes on the april meeting of the councl was particularly with regard to the policing of the traffic, especilly on the A.29, and not, as may have been inferred, to general policing in the area. It was also noted that a police survey on traffic speed in the area is to be carried out shortly.
